reviewText:
Early Access Review

1-English version.
2-Versión en español.

1--English version:

I still need to try this more, but for now this game is good and very well polished.

In my opinion, needs some balance with a few things (rain, filtrations, water floods) and an option to customize keys. Those 2 asap before adding more content.

Also, i miss a lot the possibility to use the dirt, rocks, etc you mine. All raw material, once obtained, cannot be used until converted to something. As this is a game where mobs are constantly shooting and breaking all materials and since you need also to dig and mine, this means that your base floor, favourite cave for spelunking and finally all your world, will be like a emmental cheese.

Adding the huge quantity of rain and the fact that all that you build and all those holes i was talking about flood in a mere seconds, this means you will end diving across an emmental flooded world.

Despite that, which i think is just a question of balancing water and filtrations, the game is very solid already. The movement is fluid and very well done and you can craft a good bunch of things: building materials, machinery, guns, armor, turrets for defense...

I'm eager to see more, so i will update this first opinion after testing a bit more.

Oh, i forgot, and it's so cheap that will be almost a crime not to support the developer.

2---Versión español:

Todavía necesito probarlo más, pero por ahora el juego está muy chulo y muy bien afinado.

En mi opinión, necesita equilibrar algunas cosillas (la lluvia, filtraciones de agua, inundaciones...) y una opción para personalizar los botones. Ambas cosas lo más rápido posible, incluso antes de meter más contenido.

También echo en falta la posibilidad de utilizar los bloques de tierra, rocas, etc que minas. No se puede usar ningún material en crudo si no se transforma primero en otra cosa. Como en este juego los enemigos están continuamente disparando y cargándose todo y como, obviamente, necesitas minar y cavar, esto significa que el suelo de tu base, tu cueva favorita para explorar y, en definitiva, todo tu mundo acabará pareciendo un queso emmental.

Si añadimos la enorme cantidad de lluvia que cae y el hecho de que todo lo que edifiques y todos esos agujeros que mencionaba se inundan en apenas unos segundos, ello supone que acabarás buceando a través de un mundo como un queso emmental inundado.

A pesar de ello, que creo que es tan sólo una cuestión de equilibrar el tema del agua y las filtraciones, el juego es muy sólido en el estado actual. El movimiento es fluído y muy bien ejecutado y puedes fabricar una buena cantidad de cosas: bloques para construcción, maquinaria, armas, armaduras, torretas para la defensa...

Estoy ansioso por ver más, así que actualizaré esta primera opinión en cuanto lo pruebe un poco más.

Ah!, se me olvidaba, encima el juego es tan barato que sería casi un delito no apoyar al desarrollador.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's like Terraria with more guns - IGN

Don't want to read all of this text? Check out the video review!

Pros:
_Very Terraria-esque: The addictiveness of  digging and crafting is here in full effect. Although...
_It's more action-y than Terraria: There's no slow start here, everthing is faster. You get to explore and do combat almost right away. You also dig and gather stuff a lot faster too.
_Difficult: Surviving the first night might be way harder than you think. As enemies will relentlessly chase you down and ruin your entire life.
_Exciting night time: During the night, the game plays like a tower defense, where the stuff that you painstakingly build in the daytime come under attack with waves of enemies. Set up those turrets!
_Nice, clean presentation: Very quiet soundtrack. Simple in terms of graphics as well. But everything is easy to see and interpret, and never gets in the way of the gameplay.
_It's 3 bucks: The game $3 right now. The creator mentioned that he doesn't want to sell this game at full price yet, until it's more fully featured.

Cons:
_Still in Early Access: It's not fully featured. No crashes or game breaking bugs here, fortunately. But the game is still in the process of getting more content as we speak.
_Could be too difficult at times: Or maybe I just suck. I don't really know.

Overall, you would like this game if:
_You like Terraria and looking for something different.
_You DIDN'T like Terraria and looking for something different.
_You like difficult games.
_You like Tower Defense.
_You like to kill wasps with laser guns. Seriously, ♥♥♥♥ those guys.

Is it worth the (currently) $3 price? Absolutely, it's very easy to get into this game and lose track of time. A must buy for this price point in my opinion.

Shameless plugs time! Did you like my review? I do more than just that. I also have a YouTube channel where i do Let's Play as well as more reviews like these, but in video form. Come check it out here. My channel is small right now, but I play on making it a regular thing, so hit that subscribe button to see more content. Thank you!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A sophisticated 2-D game, Dig or Die impressed me from the beginning. I don't usually play survival-type games, but this one hooked me. Stellar gameplay makes up for the moderately-good graphics. The day/night system reminds me a bit of Don't Starve in a good way. Still in Early Access, so glitches, bugs, and errors can be fixed, and improvements are sure to be made. The water simulation can be annoying, but I appreciate the consideration the developers put into this game, so as to make it this sophisticated. The monsters come in droves, forcing you to actually think about your fortifications and defenses. Physics in this game are pretty decent. All in all, for the price of $3, this game was too good to pass up! 12/10

EDIT: AFTER V0.2 UPDATE:
Graphics are even better than before, loads of things have been improved, more sophisticated systems and building/crafting physics. The game dev continues to amaze me every update, by adding something new and amazing to the mix. Definitely worth the buy (which has increased to $8) and can't wait to continue playing more!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I highly recommend this game. I have had it for one day and have already played on it for five hours.

This game may remind you of starbound or terraria but don't be fooled!
It is very different. Night time brings hordes of monsters to attack your base, every species which you have killed in the past comes back to haunt you. Build turrets and craft weapons to survive the harsh creatures. However, you will quickly learn that your greatest enemy may not be the creatures after all...

The enviroment is brutal! Rain turns into flooding in a matter of seconds and before you know it, your base on a mountain has become an elegant submarine... :) SO FUN :D

For five dollars, this game is a steal. If you want to see gameplay, check out my channel
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQs-paI3Tpj18rgMtXvQCmw

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nJust downloaded the game and already see the potential for an amazing Indie title! I say potential because although the framework for Dig or Die is solid and many updates are happening/coming, there are plenty of tweaks to be made to help with the overall enjoyment of the game. Most importatntly to me as a new player, would be to add an autosave function. The game DOES autosave every night, but the day/night cycles are long and no one wants to have to manually save, especially if they are reallly in the zone. The UI (user interface) and in-game menus are decent, but having an inventory screen where all my items are in a list feels very strange and akward. Finally, I know this might upset some people but, the RAIN is so annoying when attempting to build a house. I can put up with the physics building, but no one wants to live their entire early game in a f****** cave. I do not doubt that most players tried to build a typical survival house and watch it get flooded with water and fish to their disappointment. I understand how the game is supposed to be diffcult and rewarding, but the water is just frustraing and annoying, making the early game very not fun. Otherwise, it is a fun game and can't wait to play some more! With the game still in Early Access, I almost guarantee that the end result will be a polished and fun Indie game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

~This is a early access review and may be edited later on depending on what is released in terms of material.~
Dig or die is a cute game, Its blocky style gameplay appeals to a younger audience and is familiar to terraria but alot more forgiving in a sense. The aspects of the game are very familiar to Terraria, but are also unique in their own accord. The really cool thing that caught my attention immediately is the creation and use of turrets, Which are incidentally, key to your survival in the game. I am going to list a couple pros and cons from my inital take of the game.

Pros:
~Very unique gameplay style
~Survival relies on more than just sitting and watching your turrets blast everything away.
~Is very welcoming and has a very friendly appearance, despite its name.
~Can be used as an entrance game to other more complex varieties, such as minecraft, terraria, Ect
~Has extreme potential to be something amazing.

Cons:
-Is heavily unfinished, (not particularly fair due to it being early access)
-has a learning curve that is somewhat higher than most games of its type.
-Can be quite difficult if you dont know what your doing.

Edited: The game gets easier after many days have passed, finding out weapon upgrades and whatnot are essential, however aquiring these items to do so are often quite a challenge. @Gaddy Games, I would suggest making the world larger and making building things a little easier. Just a suggestion of course.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Would you like to loose a weekend or a week?
This game is for you.
Constant feeling of learning curve, yet not that complicated.
Satisfaction from building, exploring and constant survival.
At night, build your own defences that will keep you alive from the brothers and mothers of those creatures, you killed during the day.
During the day, spend 20% of it for looking for the nessesary resourses, no need to dig for hours, and yet, you have the feeling that you are far away, and need to control your time in order to get back to safety.
Get resourses not only from underground, but build architecture structures, that will fall in case you put too much weight on it, so think before, not after.
Will you escape from the planet, or will you stay and build it at your pleasure?
Will you be able to locate and kill all monsters in order to be able to craft prime items that will ease your survival?
This Game is a must have in the library, specially when you pay that low price.
I could easy give $15 for it without blinking, but got it only for $4.99, and no, I have not been hiered to write this review.
Developer, my hat is off.
Ronicx.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is EXTREMELY fun.

I have only 6 hours in it so far, and I have had to restart twice, build 7 different bases (which still get me killed) and have died countless... countless times. I am not going to lie. This game is hard. Very hard. But once you get used to it, and adapt to the spiecies that are in the game, and learn how to kill them off, then it gets a little easier.

I really hope the developer(s) of this game continue to post updates. As of now its $4.99 and it's really fun and enjoyable, with GREAT music that help keep the blood pumpin'.

For $4.99 this is a steal, you get many hours of fun (and agony) out of a $5 bill you can just pull right outa yo panties.

Anyway, if you are debating about getting this game, get it. Get it now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like 2d platformer games similar to Terraria, Starbound, or Risk of Rain, this game may be for you.

Caution: my review may contain spoilers

This game is similar to Terraria/Starbound in that you have to mine and find resources to achieve your goal, (which is where it is similar to Risk of Rain) in that you have to do your best to survive the oncoming waves of enemies. Another similarity this game has with Risk of Rain is that the monsters you fight night after night are harder and stronger than in previous nights, so the purpose of mining is to get resources to build and upgrade your defenses. Your ultimate goal (which I have yet to achieve) is to get the necessary resources to build a spaceship and get off the planet.

I have enjoyed the game so far, from what I have played. The controls take some getting used to and they are not the same as games like Terraria and Starbound, but if you have played those games at all, you should be able to pick up the controls pretty quick. It does take a bit of getting used to, and you may die before the first night is over on your first couple of tries, like I did. After you gather enough resources, you can build turrets and walls that will fortify your base.


----Edit: the monsters don't get harder every night - until you explore more, and run into the harder monsters. Once you attack them, you'll see swarms of them come after you at night. Only attack them when you think you can handle them.

Highly recommended! 10/10 (Especially for Terraria/Starbound/Risk of Rain players)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is just a joy.  Imagine something vaguely like Terria, but with a real sense of progression, physics, and purpose.  This game just does so much right.  Everything you do feels meaningful.   I built a base and spiked it with guns.  Why?  Because I freaking needed those guns to hold back the monsters at night or else they would destroy my base and overrun me.  I set up a semi-elaborate system of water power.  Why?  I needed to set it up so that I could use a teleporter between two areas of operation.  I built a bridge and later on a couple of towers; both of which were kind of challenging because physics actually matters a little.  I built those things for a purpose; I need to span a chasm and to get to something high.  Build your tower or bridge without enough support and it WILL fall down.  If you don’t stud them with turrets, monsters will eventually rip them down.

This game (at least right now while in Early Access) isn’t a hundreds of hours of sandbox time game.  You can play it like a sandbox, but you can also win.  I just beat it after roughly 40 hours, and I feel like I spent the right amount of time doing it.  I am satisfied and done.  If this game gets released with more content after early access, I’ll probably be back to do it again.  If it doesn’t, I’ll still be contended with what a got.  If it didn’t say Early Access, I would have never of guessed because it is pretty damn complete as it is.

The only real possible negative I could see someone having with this game is that it is smaller in terms of scope and sprawling then Terria and other Terria-alike games.  It doesn’t have a dozens of biomes or hundreds of enemies.  It is smaller, but I actually kind of find this to be a positive because it is so much tighter than other Terria-alike games.  It is like the developer picked a proper amount that they could bit off and made it exactly that big.

Overall, if you like Terria flavored games, this is easily one of the best right now.  If the developer adds more between now and release, that is all just gravy to me.  Seriously, congratulations to whoever developed this; this game is just great.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So you look at this and go.. Terraria clone! I too thought that and in many ways I was right. I went into this game expecting to hate it and return my my hovel of mud in minecraft grumble grumble. Ive played this for a few hours now and I have to say im so far.. doing well and actually enjoying it!
The basic mechanics are similar to Terraria ie mine, build, survive. But so much of the pointless crap that overwhelms Terraria has been left out, leaving a game that feels more like survival on a hostile planet, rather than spending hours trying to make some magic flaming rocket-sword to kill a flying demon eye I couldnt give a crap about so I can get a new top hat. whoop de doo!
I also feel like I have some kind of purpose, a goal, a mission! finally! something to strive for in an open (albeit 2D) world! We want freedom but want a goal! how fickle we are!
Im genuinely looking forward to seeing what the developers have in store for this game.

Dig or Die I dont hate you. I eat my hat. thumbs up!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

awesome little game that isn't entirely similiar to terraria or other games like it this one focuses on base defense and if you die you have to start from last save which A. you can save at any time or B. use the autosave from the last morning from surviving a wave

Pro's
+easily crafting just build the crafting table and it lists all available craftables for it and what it requires
+base defense focused, I would not recomoned staying outside you base over the night
+after killing a new tougher enemy that you find farther away from the base it will come after you from now on at night
+easy mining it doesn't take forever to mine or collect resources in this game
+helpfull tips what you need to aquire next to upgrade you workbench
+structures fall if it isn't properly supported
+areas that aren't easy to get to
+weapon kick back

Con's
-Not that large varity of enemies they look mostly the same but colored different would like to see more variety
-can't build very well above ground it doesn't explain how you can build bridges or towers it just says you can but I haven't been able to work around the crumbling with the supports
-areas that aren't easy to get to, this is only here because the lack of proper tower building above ground and lack of proper bridges
-the last scales you need for building the ship it didn't give a hint like sensors report a type of fish that only live deep underground"
-Once you get the best turrets you can easily defend your base without having to worry about losing any turrets
-exploring underground becomes less dangerous with the best guns and they aren't that hard to craft once you get them would like to see an enemy that burrows perhaps this will make defending yourself during the night more fun
-weapon jumping
date:
usefull but you can use it to prevent fall damage
-a bit short maybe have an endless mode where the rocket you make lands on another planet that is even tougher


all in all tl;dr all the cons that I can really think of could be ironed out during the development but very playable
recommended: fun and bug free game that I've noticed"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At a $5 price point you really cant go wrong, I finished the game in just over 10 hours.

That being said, the game is lacking in story and depth, and feels very linear for a sandbox game. This isnt Terraria and doesnt have 10,000 items/equipables to craft, the crafting is very limited, and all items are unlockable in a very linear fashion. There are few enemies, most of which are clones of earlier variations. and are not very interesting to fight. The building physics seem pretty wonky and don't work exactly how you'd expect (then again I am a carpenter by trade so i am biased XD)

As a side note the wiki is a mess and found myself stumped a few times on how to progress.

In its current form for the price I'll give it a 7/10 and would recommend if you want to kill a few hours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

10/10 for now, though I would like some changes ?
+Raining should be fixed, my base was underwater for quite a couple days until I managed to dig so far into the ground that I hit a cave and so I managed to get rid of it, though my base got almost destroyed in the process several times due to the red stinger things and the fishes that would not let me protect my base.
+I hope multiplayer will be added soon!
+More things you can do with wood ? Wood at this current state is quite useless , I find no use for it , and I find that rather bad.
+I hope for some NPC enemys to fight with / team up with (?). Also, monsters are destroying my base way too fast, so I would reccomend buffing the walls and turrets, since they get destroyed almost on an instant.
+Improve graphics ? They are pretty bad right now and just a bit of a touch would just do.
+Nothing else, the game is amazing !

SO

Overall, the game at it's current state deserves a 7/10, can't wait for new updates, very much potential, don't waste this opportunity developer , this could be a very very good game !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the price, I'd say give it a go.

I love the number of different ways you can find to drown in this game!  It's great to see a game where something as simple as rainfall can cause such huge problems.  Happily spent a couple of hours on peaceful just playing round with the water.

Which leads me to my OHGOD moment...  There's a big dude down there somewhere whom, when you approach, apparently throws the peaceful setting out the window.  And the autosave just before you meet him (an awesome idea, I can see that being a lifesaver!) seems to have saved AFTER everything I'd been walking past suddenly decided I WAS tasty after all.  I'll never see my dam again, nor break the seal to drain my giant artificial lake into the giant natural lake.

Beyond that, the progression is neat, and having to bridge the chasm to get to the next 'tech level' was nice...  the second time...  the first time involved questionable 'knowledge' of architecture and a quick lesson in gravitational forces; somewhat similar to learning why you don't stand ON the branch you're sawing off a tree...  :P  I didn't get too far into my non-peaceful try, something to do with enemies who will tunnel to you if you block them off.  A base with no foundations quickly becomes no base.  :3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun, fluid little game that is easy to grasp right from the beginning. Great physics that provides added challenges. An intuitive interface puts everything you need right there on the screen, so you dont have to go browsing a Wiki in search of help.

During the day explore, mine, harvest, hunt, craft, build and set up your defences. At night, fight off the hordes so you can live another day.

Have fun, watch your back, stay alive and escape.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For what it is I gave a thumb up. It looks good, works well and should suit the niche' player who likes this sort of game.

For the rest of us; I'm not a big fan. I find it too repeditive and single minded. Not a bad thing - more of personal taste.

Inspired by the likes of Minecraft and Starbound; the game has its crafting elements, mining and base building. Game can really push you to do things quickly and those who want some hardcore crafting\survival action should look into it.

I see good things for the title if they keep building on it. For now, i'll stick to other crafting games.

Note: The rain effects in this game are awesome. :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good game. I don't know how much more they are going to update it, since it seem pretty complete already. It's short and fun, only takes a few hours to beat if you are smart, and doesn't get repetative easily.
It does lack replayability, since it's literally the same thing over and over again, with very little variety.

The biggest problem for me is the AI pathing, which is terrible. They will simply go staight towards you, even if that means actually burrowing through a mountain, even if there is a clear path two blocks over. This can be very annoying when you have to rebuild half your base each morning.

It is also seemingly impossible to have an underground base for long, since the aliens tend to destroy everything around you. Literally. You end up with a 5+ block gap all around your base, with it just floating in the middle.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Many dopamine were released while playing this game... I haven't played a game that rewarding in a long time!!
You can actually beat the game.
You crash in a hostile alien planet and your goal is to build an rocket and get the hell outa there.
However, it's not simple. You have to collect resources and upgrade your crafting table to get better guns and build a better base. From what I've heard it take about 15-20 hours to complete the game at first try on easy mode, which I'm hours into the game and I haven't even scratched the surface of it.
10/10 must buy before the price goes skyrocketed
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best games I have downloaded from Steam in a long long time. Superb value for money. It felt like years until I got the Jetpac, but once you have it, the game really opens up!

Love - Defense turrets, ease of building, guns, monsters, did I mention the Jetpac yet? :-)
Hate - it's a bit of a hike from top to bottom initially - going down is easy, coming back up is hard if you time it badly!

This is a great game which seems to pitch the resource requirements and the difficulty of gathering those resources just right!

UPDATE: Completed after 16.2 hours.  No doubt it could be done quicker, but I really enjoyed every minute.  I really look forward to more content and any future updates for this game.

Will replay and mess with water/hydro-power :-)))

THANKS A LOT FOR MAKING THIS GAME!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nDig or die is a creative sandbox game. Like Terraria, it is a 2-D platformer where you must build, craft, and fight, or you can die from the hostile creatures of the alien planet. Unlike terraria, if you build a structure that wouldm't actually work, (floating structures) they will collapse. Yes, this game is singleplayer AT THE MOMENT. All the negative reviews that are saying it sucks because there is no multiplayer, I reccomend looking at the early access tab above. It clearly states that after early access the game will be multiplayer, so do some research before you start yapping. It really is a great game at the moment, and it's only getting better as it updates. After early access, I forsee a truly amazing game. It's worth the $5 it is now, so get it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't really like the name of this game, but that's my biggest complaint.  This game is pretty cheap, and you could put quite a bit of time into it and have fun.

The dev(s) seem really active.  About 5 hours after reviewing this, a dev actually commented on this review.  They're definitely keeping an eye on community feedback.

Even if this wasn't Early Access, I'd be happy that I bought this game because there really is a decent amount of content for the price.  I am looking forward to doing another playthrough in a few months though, hopfully they'll have added some cool new stuff by then.

There are some really cool mechanics, and I like the base building.  The mining's not revolutionary, but it's not bad, and the combat's decent.

That's about it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update - 8/22/15 - Many Thumbs Up!

I'm leaving my previous review up so that people can see just how much progress the Devs have made. This game has become incredibly fun. I would highly recommend a playthrough. It'll take you a couple tries to get the hang of it, but it is well worth the time. This is definitely a game to own and stay up to date with. The Dev is constantly involved with the player community and responds kindly and with tons of info if you are stuck or upset. Give this one a try. I got fed up at the beginning of Early Access, but the updates to this game make it worth playing.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
(Previous Review) - Thumbs Down

I'm playing on normal and can't even make it to the 3rd day. The game difficulty increases near-exponentially while your ability to upgrade is tediously slow. The acqisition of materials needed for crafting is difficult and delayed but extremely necessary to make it through even a single night.  The water is just a pain in the rear. I know it is being billed as one of the key features, but I hate it. Water accumulates even where there was no water and no way for it to get where you are. Diggin in a dry patch of dirt uphill? Lets fill it with water.  Not raining above ground? Lets make it rain underground. Can't mine through stone yet? Don't worry, the first-level enemies can blast right through it.

I typically hold off on giving a review like this, but this game needs a lot of work before I would suggest buying it.

Check back in a few months and see if there are any updates before buying. The developer is claiming to be done, if all goes well, by summer 2015? Hell no. This game is not even close to being done.

---------------------------EDIT --------------------

Close to making me change my recommendation.

So I have been back to check in on the game and here is what I've found:

Very big thumbs up for the Dev taking part in community reviews and being nicer than a grandmother with dementia. Seriously, the Dev actually seems to care if people enjoy the game. Its a nice change of pace for early access. Well played Dev!

The tutorial" given by your ship seems a bit more informative. It tells you how to get along a bit better than when I first played. If you play on easy
recommended: but it is almost too easy. I like a challenge
hoursPlayed:
but the content is still a bit lacking. I like the concept of the game and enjoyed the play through on easy.

Verdict: so-so.

Easy is now too easy and difficult is really bloody difficult. The plus side of this is that you can play on easy to get the hang of things and try your hand at difficulty settings afterwards. The updates of the game have definitely helped. My hope would be to see a "DLC" for this game to extend the game play and allow for a bit slower increase in difficulty on normal difficulty settings.

Also

reviewText:
Early Access Review

10/10 for now, though I would like some changes ?
+Raining should be fixed, my base was underwater for quite a couple days until I managed to dig so far into the ground that I hit a cave and so I managed to get rid of it, though my base got almost destroyed in the process several times due to the red stinger things and the fishes that would not let me protect my base.
+I hope multiplayer will be added soon!
+More things you can do with wood ? Wood at this current state is quite useless , I find no use for it , and I find that rather bad.
+I hope for some NPC enemys to fight with / team up with (?). Also, monsters are destroying my base way too fast, so I would reccomend buffing the walls and turrets, since they get destroyed almost on an instant.
+Improve graphics ? They are pretty bad right now and just a bit of a touch would just do.
+Nothing else, the game is amazing !

SO

Overall, the game at it's current state deserves a 7/10, can't wait for new updates, very much potential, don't waste this opportunity developer , this could be a very very good game !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PLEASE NOTE: The game is in early alpha so anything i say about the game (negative and positive) is for the game in its current state, My opinion in the future is definetly going to change after some time, and the way this game is going, its going to be a VERY, VERY good opinion.
====================================================================================

I like the idea, but i dont think its that original, (Build a base and survive the night!) Which doesnt make it bad! its just not that 'new'.

INTRO
=====
Dig or Die is a 2D Sandbox, action, adventure, strategy game. (thats a mouthful)
Your ship has crashed on an alien planet, You must use the supplies on the ship to gather recources and build a base, Then continue to build better weaponry and tools to survive the onslaught of aliens that come at night.
Explore caves and floating islands and find new aliens that are stronger and faster and will probably own you when you fist see them.
Will you be able to survive and leave the planet?
your only option is to Dig or Die.

GAMEPLAY/PROBLEMS
================
The gameplay is very fun and is worth the money. Building a badass base and big guns to kill aliens with? AWSOME

(the following paragraph is just suggestions, im not hating on the game :D)
I dont have that much time in the game but i already know what you do in the game.
get the tier 1 crafting thing-->upgrade your weapons, structures and tools--> get tier 2 crafting thing--> upgrade your weapons structures and tools--> get tier 3 crafting thing and so on.

I feel this needs to be improved on quickly to stop it being repetitive and boring. Maybe only have one crafting thing and hide the higher tier recipies untill you find a blueprint for the item (maybe have chests or something that holds items that will help you like blueprints, its just a suggestion) or until you get some of the materials for it.

COMBAT
======

The combat is very fast paced and intense which i like a lot, but i feel that there needs to be a way to instantly switch to your weapon, i lost a lot of health when trying to scroll to my weapon when i was building.

BUILDING/PHYSICS
=============

The building is simple and easy to understand. Which is good, it doesnt need to be complicated.
The physics and the flooding was a great thing to add in, it adds a much needed challenge to the game and overall makes it even more fun to play.

Again with the tier system in the game right now (T1 crafting--> T2 crafting...) i find myself not really building my base out of the building blocks that the crafting things allows us to make (wood --> stone ---> ect) because i know that i will just destroy it all to replace it with the better, higher tier blocks. (READ MY GAMEPLAY PARAGRAPH FOR MY SUGGESTION ON HOW TO FIX THIS)

BUGS
====
I have seen Hardly Any bugs which is rare for an Early alpha game, he only thing that ive seen (i dont know if its a bug or not) is that you can shoot through one-block thick walls. which makes it easy to survive the night.

OVERALL
=======
The game is very fun but very repetitve, I think it is worth the money and you will get a lot of gameplay from it.
I think this game is a time burner, you got some spare hours and dont know what to do? just play this! time seems to go by quick when trying to kill hordes of aliens and building huge towers and underground bases.

Dont forget, this game is in early alpha, There will be bugs, there will be things you dont like, but when they release the full game, ITS GONNA BE AWSOME!!!! MULTIPLAYER, BOSSES, MORE PLACES TO EXPLORE AND MORE WEAPONS AND TURRETS AND OMMGGGGGGGGGGGG....
plus if you buy the game in early alpha your getting it cheaper than the full game when its released
(it will be $12 on release..Ooooh i got it cheaper....will you?)

Overall 6/10 (untill the next major update :D)

MESSAGE TO THE DEVS:
=================
If you read this please reply, and tell me what you think about my suggestions, i plan to follow this game till there are no more updates. THANKS

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI am already 90 minutes into the game, and I must say- it's already one of my favorites.  The game is very easy to get a handle on, yet it is very difficult.  You'll find your first night way harder than you thought it was going to be (if you kill something on your first day) with bees trying to gun you down and dogs rushing and destroying your base.  The difficulty makes the game more fun however and allows focus on uprgrading your base and tools.  This is NOT a Minecraft clone (thank god) and is one of a kind.  It focuses rather on an objective and defense, rather than worrying about hunger and how stylish your home is.  You wont be crafting pioneer tools such as pickaxes, axes, swords, etc., but rather laser guns, a tool that extracts resources by rays, and other unique, futuristic items.  I am really excited to see where this game goes and what type of stuff they will add in that will keep the survival-defensive like feel while keeping things fresh and new.  I hope they will add multiplayer sometime soon!

Early Access Review

A basic Crafting-Survival title, Dig or Die takes a concrete yet popular premise, and executes it brilliantly. The very simple playstyle with a multitude of diffculty levels means there's something for everyone, of any age. And at just under $3, this title is well-worth the money. I'm looking forward to seeing what else comes from the Devs on this title, while it finishes up its Early Access status.

I would, however, have liked to see more content. Gameplay was relatively short, even for Early Access.

I give it an 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First I was really questioning if this game was fun at all. The only reason why I bought it was because I had an extra 5 dollars after a game purchase. Well lets just say this is one of the funnest games I have palyed in a long time.

This is a 2d style game that surprised me how fun it was.

At first its confusing to play. For example, enemies digging strait to you at night from the surface. I abandoned my surface base to make a deep underground one and well... no they were coming from the caverns. Eventually I made a near surface base and found a way to prevent this from happening. I wont spoil it, find out how to yourself.

Water is a force your going to have to deal with. Occasionally when building down you need run off areas (Massive hole near by) Or spare water tanks incase the area gets flooded. Dirt also holds water, and if enough is removed you can quickly find an area flooded. Rain also seeps through dirt, flooding anything down below, however this is easily blocked.

I'm awaiting for more updates, I beleive this game is going to be a blast full release. Also I dont see multiplayer options at the moment, so its sp only.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At a $5 price point you really cant go wrong, I finished the game in just over 10 hours.

That being said, the game is lacking in story and depth, and feels very linear for a sandbox game. This isnt Terraria and doesnt have 10,000 items/equipables to craft, the crafting is very limited, and all items are unlockable in a very linear fashion. There are few enemies, most of which are clones of earlier variations. and are not very interesting to fight. The building physics seem pretty wonky and don't work exactly how you'd expect (then again I am a carpenter by trade so i am biased XD)

As a side note the wiki is a mess and found myself stumped a few times on how to progress.

In its current form for the price I'll give it a 7/10 and would recommend if you want to kill a few hours.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is truly amazing. I recommend it for any sandbox fans for many reasons. 1 the physics adds new challenges and forces you to think out your builds. 2 the monsters are amazing, have great AIs and they also can break blocks. One thing that I would definetly change is the amount of uranium and sky islands. I understand that uranium is really rare, but I have searched my whole world and do not have enough uranium to build my rocket ship. Also it is really difficult to find sky islnads, and I constantly find myself haveing to go cave diving more to get the materials to build another tower just to get to the firefly boss. Overall though tis game has amazing gameplay and you should buy it now before it has a full release and has it's price raise. I enjoy being able to comment on this game and give support and ideas.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's like Terraria, but less tedious. Your character is 1x1 blocks in size, making traversing underground much faster. You only have/need one resource harvesting tool, which you can use regardless of what you have equipped with the right mouse button. The escalation in what can make and what enemies you have to worry about is well done. The building physics and nightly enemy swarms will keep you engaged in building/improving your base. I usually pass on early access games, but I totally reccommend going ahead and picking this up.

Early Access Review

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very good game. I don't know how much more they are going to update it, since it seem pretty complete already. It's short and fun, only takes a few hours to beat if you are smart, and doesn't get repetative easily.
It does lack replayability, since it's literally the same thing over and over again, with very little variety.

The biggest problem for me is the AI pathing, which is terrible. They will simply go staight towards you, even if that means actually burrowing through a mountain, even if there is a clear path two blocks over. This can be very annoying when you have to rebuild half your base each morning.

It is also seemingly impossible to have an underground base for long, since the aliens tend to destroy everything around you. Literally. You end up with a 5+ block gap all around your base, with it just floating in the middle.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is as simple as the title, dig or die.

Building a base, defending it, mining and killing for resources, and crafting all while you build a rocket to escape is very enjoyable. I found myself coming back to my old saves just to defend my house from aliens creatures with my turrets is fun.
It's great if you want an hour or two to waste.

My only issue with the game is how short it is, building the rocket should take much longer as to give you a reason to keep playing and defending your base.

This game is worth the mere 5 dollars if you want some simple fun.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can definitely say that Dig or Die is easily worth $5 in its current state. I'm not entirely sure what additional development is supposed to be added to this game but as is" the game is worth the cost by a long shot.

If you've played Terreria or Starbound then you'll feel right at home playing this game. The major difference at this point between Dig or Die and those games is both difficulty and depth. Dig or Die is far less deep and much less difficult at all stages of the game. While I've yet to beat Dig or Die I've played 7 hours and nearly completed what I percieve to be the end of the game. I'd venture to say I'd need 3-4 more hours to complete it at most.

I've played more than 50 hrs in Terreria and Starbound each and I've not come close to completing those games.

Dig or Die stands on its own in my mind. Beyond look and feel Dig or Die is a different game than Terreria or Starbound.

Dig or Die doesn't require the same level of non-stop grinding that the other two games do. The learning curve is significantly lower and the strategy required to succeed only needs average execution for survival/progression.

Pros:
-Only $5
-More of a Causal Play (easy to pick up)
-Low Learning Curve
-Relatively short Start to End
-No excessive grinding
-Graphics 8/10 (for this genre)
-Mechanics are smooth
-Fun 8/10

Cons:
-A bit too shallow (I realize its early release)
-Can feel a bit repetitive between tiers
-Game allows player to get too OP by mid-late game
-Very little consequence for dying

All in all I'd say spend the $5
date: playthrough in about 10-20 hours (depends on skill)
recommended: and then see what new things the developer adds."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A basic Crafting-Survival title, Dig or Die takes a concrete yet popular premise, and executes it brilliantly. The very simple playstyle with a multitude of diffculty levels means there's something for everyone, of any age. And at just under $3, this title is well-worth the money. I'm looking forward to seeing what else comes from the Devs on this title, while it finishes up its Early Access status.

I would, however, have liked to see more content. Gameplay was relatively short, even for Early Access.

I give it an 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This one has really good game mechanics.

Think SciFi Terraria with phisics for material resistance like in 7 days (But applied only to Your buildings above ground - sorry no cavein's here). You can use water physics to generate power for advanced machinery or to rise water to reach inaccessible places.

Combat is more focused on base building and planning Your defences against attacks during the night.

The difficulty of the game changes as You progress from Your starting point: As You kill a new, more powerfull type of creature they will also start attacking You during the night. And to reach some places You need to learn how to build a tower or bidge that does not fall to pieces under its own weight. No sand elevators" or "hanging platform bridges"
date: and this is why I love this game.\n\nDon't be afraid of (low) price. The developers have been genious in delivering a really fun product that delivers much more than You could expect."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Didn't expect much from this, thought it was another Terraria knockoff but, for the price, this is one of the best games I've bought this year. For a game on version 0.1X, this has a hell of a lot of content.

The building physics are a nice touch, if a little buggy;  but all round this is a really really promising game. As long as content keeps getting added and the water physics refined a bit, this is a gem.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First off i want to say this
PLEASE DON'T JUDGE THIS GAME BY HOW IT LOOKS!

This game i truely an gem in the midst of alot of terraria/minecraft clones. DoD introduce some game mechanics that you can't find i that many games.

Just try to imagine this:
You're standing quietly in your newly build base trying to craft some potions, but then suddenly you are ambushed by spiky turtles" and vicious dogs and shooting mosquitoes (size of a big bird) because they dug through you base! and suddenly the base is flooded because you forgot to dig a way for the water to drain. That is basically what will happen in this game.

But do bear in mind that this game is in alpha
date: so don't expect some massive game that you will spend 500+ hours on. although it is a game you can play again and again.\n\nAll in all i would give this game as it is now 7/10
recommended: however if i were to rate the potential of this i would say 9/10!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a very pleasant little game, with a suprisingly large amount to do for being in the early state that it is. It runs very well, no problems. Playing for the time that I did, I couldn't actually find a single bug, which is doubly suprising for, again, the very early state that it is in. The only problems that I have with this game are that the water never really seems to dissipate, and just keeps building up in underground caverns. Also, the building support system can be a bit wonky at times.

Other than those minor gripes, the game is just incredibly fun to play. I heartily reccomend it.

+I hope for some NPC enemys to fight with / team up with (?). Also, monsters are destroying my base way too fast, so I would reccomend buffing the walls and turrets, since they get destroyed almost on an instant.
+Improve graphics ? They are pretty bad right now and just a bit of a touch would just do.
+Nothing else, the game is amazing !

SO

Overall, the game at it's current state deserves a 7/10, can't wait for new updates, very much potential, don't waste this opportunity developer , this could be a very very good game !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I cannot recommend this game anymore than I physically can - 150% Worth buying!
I played a decent amount of time - so far until I decided I MUST let the community know how good this game is.
In this review, I will cover the good things and the bad things.

So, lets start with the good things:

1. Awesome idea actually been created like it was planned, unlike some games.

2. BETTER Than Terraria. I prefer this to Terraria because it's much funner and you can actually do much more things.

3. The physics make the game SO much funner, like a lot more.

4. It's gameplay is smooth and is easy to learn controls.

5. The artificial intelligence of the ship is so good, it gives you company.

6. The way you get hooked in after a few minutes is amazing.

7. The defenses, they're awesome.

8. The amount of cool things to build and do.

9. The variety of mobs, blocks and biomes.

10. The way it takes the irritating things from Terraria and makes them unexistant.

11. The way the structures have a limit to their strength, that forces you to make things like real life, like a bridge with supports. It makes the game so much more pretty with actual nicely structured houses/buildings/bridges etc.

12. The way you generate power, is so complex and difficult, that when you finish it, you get to biggest dopamine (Chemical your brain releases after an achievement to award yourself/feels awesome) rush you will ever have in your life!

The bad things:

1. It's early access.

2. The ground mob AI is awful.

3. The way you get attacked by an immense amount of creatures at night, it shouldn't be that much.

4. The dumb saving system - It needs an upgrade.

5. The way your turrets die far too fast.

6. The loss of health is insane when against a creature with a high HP.

7. The way you have to go back to a previous save if you die - IT'S ANNOYING, Just set a respawn code in.

8. The size of the world, it is the same for everybody, so why is it so small? I wanted a big world to explore, not small.

9. The way you don't move in flowing water, that's just so unrealistic in a physics game.

10. Some minerals are far too hard to find, it ruins the game having to look for hours to find an ore.

There you go! If you wish me to go into detail about any of these or want me to purchase another game to test for you and give improvements, then email me at winnerasyougo@gmail.com

I look forward to seeing this game progress through early access and I hope you use my review to improve the game!

I hope you find this review useful and/or wish to use it as feedback. Please get back in touch if you need anything!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the price, I'd say give it a go.

I love the number of different ways you can find to drown in this game!  It's great to see a game where something as simple as rainfall can cause such huge problems.  Happily spent a couple of hours on peaceful just playing round with the water.

Which leads me to my OHGOD moment...  There's a big dude down there somewhere whom, when you approach, apparently throws the peaceful setting out the window.  And the autosave just before you meet him (an awesome idea, I can see that being a lifesaver!) seems to have saved AFTER everything I'd been walking past suddenly decided I WAS tasty after all.  I'll never see my dam again, nor break the seal to drain my giant artificial lake into the giant natural lake.

Beyond that, the progression is neat, and having to bridge the chasm to get to the next 'tech level' was nice...  the second time...  the first time involved questionable 'knowledge' of architecture and a quick lesson in gravitational forces; somewhat similar to learning why you don't stand ON the branch you're sawing off a tree...  :P  I didn't get too far into my non-peaceful try, something to do with enemies who will tunnel to you if you block them off.  A base with no foundations quickly becomes no base.  :3

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's like Terraria, but less tedious. Your character is 1x1 blocks in size, making traversing underground much faster. You only have/need one resource harvesting tool, which you can use regardless of what you have equipped with the right mouse button. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is as simple as the title, dig or die.

Building a base, defending it, mining and killing for resources, and crafting all while you build a rocket to escape is very enjoyable. I found myself coming back to my old saves just to defend my house from aliens creatures with my turrets is fun.
It's great if you want an hour or two to waste.

My only issue with the game is how short it is, building the rocket should take much longer as to give you a reason to keep playing and defending your base.

This game is worth the mere 5 dollars if you want some simple fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Highly recommended.  Don't let the cute aestethic fool you, this is a challenging game.  What makes it different:  Water mechanic/physics - They are still balancing this, but I'm enjoying the additional challenge it poses.  Building physics, tension and sheer force.  Plan your buildings, bridges and towers to get placse otherwise you'll be sorry when they collapse.  And at night it's defense, as any mob you attack during the day will attack at night.  Build a base and lots of turrets and hunker down.

The alpha branch is also available to play if you prefer bugs, but I have yet to run into any in the beta branch or alpha branch.

Even if you get this game later after it is early access, I think that this game will still be worth it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I enjoy this game much more than Terraria, which I love.

The battle system is efficient, building is straight-forward, and the game opens itself up to you in easy-to-learn, bite-sized segments. Your progression is based on your thirst for exploration. The way this game has you build bases is intuitive and very open-ended.

The story present in the game is fun and doesn't take itself too seriously, but still manages to deliver. Music is enjoyable, but some enemy sound effects do get tiring. The days sometimes feel very short, but I felt that it (fairly) added to the challenge. Replayability is high, and also works nicely to support multiple playthroughs at once.

This game is worth the price tag, exceeding it by far. If you like Terraria, Minecraft, and the like, you will find that Dig or Die is a great game in the exploration/survival genre.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To be honest, I first saw this via gameplay posted by Chimneyswift. It looked fun, and the fact that it was so inexpensive also helped me along. For me, the fact that it is currently in early-access means I get to actually have a game from its release, and watch it grow and evolve. The game itself is one I enjoy. A lot. It is reminescent of Terraria, but it has a stronger grasp on physics. I discovered that to build a bridge across a certain chasm, I needed to have a huge support for one half, then I had to use the shotgun's recoil to jump to a small ledge on the other side, and build another oversized concrete arch. I managed to connect the two, and it didn't fall!
The guns have recoil in the game, with the shotgun having the most as far as I have experienced. You can aim in the opposite direction of where you are going and pull the trigger, preferably while jumping, and you'll propel yourself across the terrain with ease. It reminds me of rocket jumping in TF2.
Now, onto the enemies: they start out nice and easy, just your basic horn hounds and whatever the bee thingies are in the beginning. The bees are ranged, but the power crystals they drop are essential. You are able to craft some turrets early on, and you WILL need them when night comes. Luckily, night is rather short, but very intense. I have survived maybe seven or eight nights, and have lost an unfortunate amount of my turrets. This is due to the black variant of the bees having a long burst of stinger-plasma-bolt-thingies, each dealing 6 damage with-out armor. They melt terrain, and your defenses along with it.
It all creates a unique and difficult challenge, which I quite enjoy. The music is... Incredible, to say the least, and the gameplay is addicting. I don't really know what I could recommend to be added, because I just have no idea WHAT to add. I'm a player, not a programmer. (No, not THAT kind.) So, all in all, this game has my attention, and it will keep my attention. I am eager to see how it all unfolds.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: It is one of the best Terraria clones. Recommended.

Plus:
- Actual objectives, that make exploring mandatory
- Sci-fi environment
- Very fast digging speed
- More realistic building and structures (building a larger bridge or tower is an actual challenge)
- At night monsters come, changing the pace of the game
- Endless inventory

So-so:
- Monsters can dig, so you can't build unpenetratable defences.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although this isn't a bad thing, Dig or Die reminds me heavily of Terraria, but I won't get into why.

PROS:
-Great music.
-Solid crafting system.
-Good challenge.
-Impressive physics.
-Overall fun game.

CONS:
-Enemies can dig through dirt with their attacks.
-Enemies can detect you through solid objects.
-Rain occurs far too often, almost more often than not.
-The health regen you have is almost negligible, especially at night when you have a ton of enemies attacking you at once.
-Death can occur rather quickly even in daylight if you aren't careful and wary of the enemies.
-The distance at which enemies will stop following you is 27 blocks. That generally means they have to be off your screen, but quite a few early enemies are faster than you.
-Because of how the physics work, it has been nearly impossible for me to build a successful bridge, even when I know I'm doing it correctly. I have fallen to the depths of the world 3 times now, and I've barely been playing for an hour.

Overall, it is an OK game, one that I do recommend, but expect a lot of somewhat unnecessary challenge (for reference to the difficulty, I've only been playing on the second-easiest difficulty so far.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is pretty fun. I've been playing it off and on, a little here and there since it first came out on Steam. The developer is very friendly and interacts with the community a lot, often fixing bugs ASAP when he sees a bug report. It gets new features added all the time.

To be clea, this is a survival game. This is not building cute structures or making emoji faces with lego blocks. You have to survive nightly onslaughts from creatures you killed throughout the game. The more creatures you kill, the more that show up. It's pretty entertaining, and I'd say well worth $10, let alone a mere $5 or even a good steam sale. If you like playing building games and you'd like to try a fun terraria-esque survival game, buy it!

8/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR: It is one of the best Terraria clones. Recommended.

Plus:
- Actual objectives, that make exploring mandatory
- Sci-fi environment
- Very fast digging speed
- More realistic building and structures (building a larger bridge or tower is an actual challenge)
- At night monsters come, changing the pace of the game
- Endless inventory

So-so:
- Monsters can dig, so you can't build unpenetratable defences.
- The water behaves more realistical.  I think it doesn't change a lot of things after all, just mentioned since it is different here.

Minus:
- not a lot of items to create
- not a lot of variety in enemies
- no summonables (or at least I didn't found any). Just turrets.
- still a Terraria clone

All in all I recommend it, good fun, especially for 5$. I hope the devs will add more content.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have an irrational fear of everything, mainly including but not limited to: fireflies, hounds, bats, red fireflies, super-fast-regenerating fish, cave lizard-monsters, black hounds, black fireflies, black cave lizard-monsters, black bats, black super-fast-regenerating fish, a crab-octopus hybrid thing, sharks, exploding fireflies, ants with armour, ants with acid, a firefly queen, a cave lizard-monster king, spiders from lava, bats from lava, bugs that shoot lasers at you, bird-insects that shoot lasers at you, bird-insects that shoot lasers at you in ARMOUR, a demon and a demon's wife (yes, those are literally all the enemies and bosses in the game, as of v0.24). No, but seriously. If you like Terraria-esque games and you like a challenge, this is the game for you. It has a ton of content and, in my opinion, has smooth and polished game mechanics that'll prove to be a nuisance (in a good way) for your bases and an advantage for the monsters trying to eat you alive. Sometimes, you'll have to rush to get a new weapon before the day is over, because that's when the baddies come. Other days, you'll be mining around for minerals to create turrets, probably the only things that'll protect and fight for you. Oh, and dont forget about the save mechanic. Once you die in the game, you have to load from the most recent save; whether thats 3 seconds ago or 3 days ago, it's up to you to save the game if you want to save" yourself. All in all
date: this is a very fun game
recommended: one that I would definitely recommend to anyone who has read this far. Be cautious about what difficulty you pick though... COUGH COUGH BRUTAL MODE COUGH"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If I made this game, I would have called it swim or die.  Or noah's ark 2.  There is water everywhere, and it gets a little insane.  At this point in time, I would say this isn't such a great game, and that I wouldn't recommend it until it comes off early access.

The good parts of this game is the music for sure!  It's very upbeat during nighttime.  It sets a good atmosphere, and it works pretty well with the game.  I love the backgrounds above ground, and I honestly like the building physics.  It makes sense and is fun to try and build something nice while avoiding it collapsing.

The bad parts of the game, as I mentioned before, is the water.  Mind you, I love rain in video games, but I started to dread it when a storm came in.  It is almost impossible to get out of a cave after it rains because the current is so strong, and If you build your house wrong, it floods.  I feel like I had to maintain the landscape and caves of the game, to allow it to drain properly.  I really like the idea that the world was flooding, but the water needed to drain faster, and the current is just too strong.

Another annoying thing about the game was the movement.  I could be walking on flat ground and it would seem like I was being jerked around in the other direction.  He would almost stutter back and forth as he walked.  Same for the mobs.  The character's jumping is also really strange, because it seems like he jumps differently every time.  Sometimes he'll jump really short, and other times he'll jump his normal height.  It makes it really hard to get around the terrain that way.  I really like the shotgun, and I love that there is knock back from the weapon, but it can get a little too out of hand. A couple of shots and I'm either a third across the map, or I'm careening down the cave shaft.

The crafting could use more explanation.  I have a lot of ingredients, like grass, but don't know what to do with it all.  Could use a chest or something to keep all the junk until you upgrade crafting stations.  Also the underground is a bit boring.  The graphics are very simple, but it just needs something to break up the really mundane rock and dirt.

Not bad for so inexpensive, but it definitely needs some work.  I'll be interested to see how it updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love the game, sort of easy to catch on to, and very fun! Get it if your into Terraria.
You start out with a basic gun and a Deatomizer and a MK1 Auto-Builder, but as you progress, you get the MK2, MK3, and the MK4. You get turrets and better guns, better building blocks, harder monsters to fight, armor, and health regen potions. Going to try not to spoil the guns or turrets or anything past MK1 for you.
With the MK1, you can get a shotgun, or get a turret that can go on walls and has a 180 degrees view field. You build some basic blocks out of wood, and start working up to the MK2. Now, there are some minor bugs or glitches here and there..
Like, well, why does your inventory tell you have 0 of something when you run out, and keeps it in your hotbar? It is a little bit annoying when my hotbar gets filled up by nonexistent items... and then you have those dogs or wolves or the (spoiler) dwellers that jump and can hit you thru one block spaces. I have died tons of times because of me being on low health, and then a wolf is like, Na bruh you gonna die" (mario jump) boop hit through the floor. Then there is a sort of useful glitch where you can completely pause the game
recommended: (opening your inventory) and click something in your inventory or I think dragging it to your hotbar. *cough* health pots.. *cough*\nNow
hoursPlayed: that can be extremely useful is clutch situations when you are gonna die

I accually got this game as a gift, and I am so happy I was given this. Dig Or Die is a Terraria - styled game
(2D sandbox Survival), and It has amazing potential. I got this game less than 2 months after it's release, and since this it has grown so much. The developers are working on lava, and many new additions. For 4.99 USD, the game is worth it.
If you don't like survival games or Sandbox games, then I don't reccomend this, but If you like a challenge, then this is the game for you. It is a very hard game, yet ver, very fun. 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First Impressions:
- Copy of Terraira
- Good graphic's
- Decent gameplay
- Low price (20 KR)
- Early Access
- Easy to learn
- Built a decent base within 2-3 hours of playing, tons of fun! (Peaceful, i thought the monsters would attack, but found out that they dont :D!)
- Good logo's.
- 468 Positive Reviews & 24 Negative, thats quite impressive in the start!
- Read some reviews and found it good enough to buy.

Bad sides of this game:
- Somethimes animals will stack and it can come very many animals at one place.
- The water in game is a little bugged, not problematic, but a little.
- The game will somethimes lagg for people who doesnt have the best specs, when its going to save. (Tested on pc with low specs. And tested on pc with high specs.)

You SHOULD buy the game, its worth it!

- MultiGamerClub

~ Terraria Style? BUY BUY BUY! ~ Anon.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGood game. I love the cocept, story (because i like alien stuff so im a littele bias) but it could use improvements. For ex,  I  cannot build sideways to build a bridge. I understand why its like this, but as time goes on you can get bored of it qiuckley. I also would LOVE it if you could build like, a robot. Like, it would patroll an area within a certain amount of blocks, or if you could get a pet like in terraria. I understand it is hard to make a game, but this gets old fast. It does have replayability, but could definantly use some improvements. I also wish doors where a thing, like they would block some water or at least delay it before it floods the location. It is worth buying at its current state, but I want it to have a buldable community like terraria, wich is what i loved most about the game. Hope my looooong opinion helped, please let me know if I was being stupid or said something that is already there and I just havent realized.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

36 hours in three days.

Well designed and implemented and very stable--v0.11.  Small download, large value.

After I took the name of the game seriously and survived my first week it became even more fun.  Now I've started building larger projects.   Not because I have too, it's just fun.

It never fails, I'm mining the last minerals I need for a project, well away from base, then music changes to nighttime theme....run.  They're coming.   Luckily the game auto-saves at daybreak.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very rare to see an early access that can still be called a working game. No bugs so far, dev promises an end game but I have'nt played long enough to achieve this. It is pretty difficult, but you can save anytime. There is some trial and error gameplay using saves, ex: try to find the mineral to unlock next set of stuff and die, or try to build base up using gravity system and it all collapses, or build underground and the whole thing gets flooded. The biggest innovation with this versus anyother sidescroller exploration is the realistic water. Its a very wet planet and when it rains the water level rises, then seeps away. There is gravity controlling the water, if you dig down through a flooded tunnel into a dry one, all the water will drain into that one basically. A very interesting and fresh puzzle aspect to the survival/exporation theme.
I never get into early acess games because they usually are pipe dream half ♥♥♥♥♥ and never get finished. This one is worth the 5 bucks because it is a complete game (as in it works top to bottom compared to others) just needs more content. Very good execution of early access, reminds me of Killing Floor 2's early access: it was a working game will very little content, devs adding on and balancing going forward.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has alot of potential.  It's alot like Craft the World where you craft things you need from resources you find in the surrounding environment. It is in early development, that being said it is good for the stage that it is in. The User interface is not very fluid at the moment of this review. It hard to deterrmine what you have and what builds what and where to find what you need. It's not easy to figure out what everything is and what makes what and building a base is confusing at the moment. I built a couple of turrets to guard from the monsters at night and explored quite a bit, playing it on normal. I played for around 30 minutes before I got a tad frustrated in what exactly I needed to do to start building my base and wall placement for it is sorta confusing and I did not see a door i could place amongst my walls to build my base. Terraforming is kinda hard to do and clunky atm. I see much potential though and will keep an eye on this title from time to time to see if it gets better. For now I will give the game a 6/10 because it is cheap and it is fun if you want to muddle through for a few hours dying over and over again and trying to get the materials you need to build things you need etc.

On a side note to all developers that use the word share in their reason for having a early release, if you are charging money for the game you are sharing" then I think the proper word is SELL the game not share it."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is amazing. solid 9.5/10 considering its early access. as a game, if this were to be realeased now at this price, 8/10.

The developer is so interactive, if you post a question on the discussion thread, you have a high likelyhood of him personally answering it, as long as someone else doesnt get there first.

the suggestions thread is the same. he reads all suggestions and responds to nearly all.

the game itself has a great physics engine, with the most accurate warter physics I ahve ever seen in a sandbox game, with rain, runoff and infiltration mechanics all working properly.

the game is balanced with next to no grinding, and is gated based on your personal skill level.

words cannot describe how few games are of this quality.

get it now.

Early Access Review

Overall pretty good. At the beginning it's pretty easy, but then it gets more difficult. It's kind of like Terraria with a mix of Sci-Fi, to the point where you end up with hundreds of turrets, guns and enemies. I suggest beginners start with easy difficulty, instead of normal or hard, as without enough experience it's almost impossible to live on normal difficulty... Trust me, I've experienced this myself.

The only downside that I've noticed is that it doesn't have a multiplayer mode yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far I've enjoyed most of what I've done in-game, but there certainly are things that could be improved.

My experience with this game, including some constructive criticism.

I spent most of the time gathering resources for crafting since better items are always essential. The amount of items you can craft is fairly decent, personally I can't complain. Though, I would very much like to see more items in the future.

Combat is typical platform-style game, but the fact that you can make better weapons adds up. What I disliked the most was the amount of monsters that spawn at night. It's nearly impossible to be safe, even in a concrete building. I found out that digging down to stay out of sight from the monsters worked best. Don't even consider building a house unless you figure something out.
NOTE: You can't build doors as far as I'm concerned. I'm not sure if you can with the tier 3 crafting system.

I like the physics, all though the rain/water can be a little annoying at some points.

Conclusion: I would like more content. Somewhat reduced monsters at night (or content such as traps, guards, more turrets, better building material etc.)

Overall it's a great game with potential for the price. If I were to compare this to anything, I'd probably say Starbound or Terraria.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

100% satisfied with this game!

As a fan of the builder/sandbox genre, I did not anticipate this game to offer much - let alone being in early access. The implementation of physics in game play has changed the way I look at the genre.

The developer has a clear passion on QUALITY and CONTENT over making a quick buck. Only but a quick glance at the discussion boards shows the developer is involved with the community, is open and willing to consider suggestions or feedback, and wants players to have the most fun out of the loose change spent on this fantastic product.

So if you have a few spare bucks - pick up this game. Although in Early Access, Dig or Die provides a great deal of enjoyment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Built a cave deep inside a mountain.
Spent days building a rocket inside the cave.
Checklist complete. Everything set. Launch ready.
Boarded the rocket. Launched the rocket.
Rocket headed for ceiling of cave.
Facepalm. Forgot to carve rocket exit path.
Rocket continues through ceiling and rest of the mountain.
2D physics. Flat objects. Slide right past each other.
Totally legit. :)

9/10 Great 2D physics sandbox. Some areas could use touching up (graphics, sound). Developer has indicated intent to improve. Game is still early access and has awesome potential. I'm very satisfied with my purchase. :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I died.
Then I made a modest home to spend the night in, since it's dangerous outside. They destroyed my house and I died. I made a bunker, surrounded by 2 meters concrete on each side. It rained and the bunker was flooded, I had to leave and I died. Then I made a bunker with a sewer system. Turns out they were still around even by daylight. I had to choose between dying or clinging to every second of life while they restlessly bashed on the concrete. I died. But then I made a fort with tall walls, a tight sewer and a ton of mounted guns. The night was fierce with fighting and they managed to take down one of my walls, but it lasted just enough to bring me the joy of seeing another day. They say there's plants that will help me get technology for better building materials to the west. I couldn't manage to build an entire bridge across the chasm because the materials were so close to giving, but I think with the right push I might make it across in a jump, taking a one way trip, at least for now, to never before explored lands. Maybe with that technology I'll be able to reach the floating islands that seem so much safer, and finally sleep well. Wish me luck.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an incredibly fun game. It is a sandbox style game but there is an ending and that made me want to play it untl i was done. You can build complex underground structures and the structural physics adds another dimension, and one of the kye aspects of game play. The power system is also another awesome part of building and designing your base.

One thing that i really enjoyed was how tense the nights can gets. In most world builders, the night time becomes trivial after you have geared up but in this game you are scrambling to make it to your base or build temporary bases. Overall a really enjoyable experience that i recommend!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You thought this was a terraria clone?

You're in for a suprize.

Okay, thats quick. Now what this game has to offer?
Lets go through together.

Your main challenge is physics and rain. Physics the bane of your bridge and rain the bane of your house.

Rain is short but happens often and flood your place, so be careful. this is a hard challenge to a base to not become a pool. But you can harness rain for hydrolectric power.

Physics make it hard. Certain challenges, such as a ravine to get something on the other side, you need to BUILD there. good luck.

Day is craft and dig.
Night becomes a tower defence game.
Hordes of enemies come and attack your base at night.
EVERYTHING wants to kill you, day or night.

This is enough.
all u need to know, this game is awsoeme, despite an odd name.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So, this is your standard 2D sidescrolling sandbox adventure game. Just, it looks like it was made in flash. There's some decent pros and cons that I'll get into later. So, in short: Why do I recommend it? Because it's $2.99. and it's not too hard to get more value out of this than your local fast food dollar menu. There's mandatory gap(s) to build over, so it forces you to use the bridge system. Toped with structural integrity of some sort, you may have zero luck doing whatever. It's a fairly quick play. If I had to guess, you could speed run this in about an hour from begiunning to end. But that may not be giving the game enough credit, due to some of the (current) end game collection needs.

The long version:

Without comparing it to obvious titles, this is your standard 2d sidescrollking sanbox adventure game. You're bound within a certain width of the map, and you spawn in the middle of it. You're given a basic box (it does all your crafting, because lore) with some basic recipes in it. You do the standard 'break and kill things for loot' and use it to make a larger, more advanced box to craft upgrades for your collection tools, guns, make new blocks etc.

Pros:

Clean graphics - Simple yet charming graphics make it easy to comprehend the background from foreground.
Physics - The blocks you place have physics, and will deconstruct themselves if you don't have any structural integrity.
Water - There's lots of it. Always. The water physics are quite good. Gravity affected, and follow semi-normal laws.
Cheap - It's stupid cheap, better than a dollar menu!

Cons:

The graphics look like they were made in flash. Charming as they may be, it looks like a title from newgrounds from the early 2000's.
Too much water. There's always water, and it doesn't go away, it just falls through caves and fills up somewhere.
Early access- This is ONLY a con, due to the lack of content. But for the price, I suggest you get over it. Its your money, don't buy if you don't want to.

Do I recommend? Sure, why not. If I compare this to buying like 3 tacos, or 3 double cheese burgers I was able to enjoy this much longer, and it didn't make me poop (pooping is quite good for you though, this game offers no health benefits).

I can't take this seriously anymore.
